user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_io_init:
```c
void metal_io_init(struct metal_io_region *io, void *virt,
	      const metal_phys_addr_t *physmap, size_t size,
	      unsigned int page_shift, unsigned int mem_flags,
	      const struct metal_io_ops *ops)
{
	const struct metal_io_ops nops = {
		NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL
	};

	io->virt = virt;
	io->physmap = physmap;
	io->size = size;
	io->page_shift = page_shift;
	if (page_shift >= sizeof(io->page_mask) * CHAR_BIT)
		/* avoid overflow */
		io->page_mask = -1UL;
	else
		io->page_mask = (1UL << page_shift) - 1UL;
	io->mem_flags = mem_flags;
	io->ops = ops ? *ops : nops;
	metal_sys_io_mem_map(io);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_io_init:
#define metal_sys_io_mem_map(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
struct metal_io_ops {
	uint64_t	(*read)(struct metal_io_region *io,
				unsigned long offset,
				memory_order order,
				int width);
	void		(*write)(struct metal_io_region *io,
				 unsigned long offset,
				 uint64_t value,
				 memory_order order,
				 int width);
	int		(*block_read)(struct metal_io_region *io,
				      unsigned long offset,
				      void *restrict dst,
				      memory_order order,
				      int len);
	int		(*block_write)(struct metal_io_region *io,
				       unsigned long offset,
				       const void *restrict src,
				       memory_order order,
				       int len);
	void		(*block_set)(struct metal_io_region *io,
				     unsigned long offset,
				     unsigned char value,
				     memory_order order,
				     int len);
	void		(*close)(struct metal_io_region *io);
	metal_phys_addr_t (*offset_to_phys)(struct metal_io_region *io,
					    unsigned long offset);
	unsigned long	(*phys_to_offset)(struct metal_io_region *io,
					  metal_phys_addr_t phys);
}
...
struct metal_io_region {
	void			*virt;      /**< base virtual address */
	const metal_phys_addr_t	*physmap;   /**< table of base physical address
						 of each of the pages in the I/O
						 region */
	size_t			size;       /**< size of the I/O region */
	unsigned long		page_shift; /**< page shift of I/O region */
	metal_phys_addr_t	page_mask;  /**< page mask of I/O region */
	unsigned int		mem_flags;  /**< memory attribute of the
						 I/O region */
	struct metal_io_ops	ops;        /**< I/O region operations */
}
...
typedef unsigned long metal_phys_addr_t
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 forbids using the Standard Library function memcmp to compare null-terminated strings. In the provided code fragments there are no calls to memcmp (nor to strcmp/strncmp or any other standard-library string-compare functions), and there is no code that compares C strings or relies on null-terminated string comparisons. The metal_sys_io_mem_map macro is defined as empty in the supplied snippet, so it does not hide any memcmp usage. The struct metal_io_ops contains function-pointer types that could be implemented elsewhere, but those implementations are not part of the provided code and therefore are outside the scope of this review. Consequently, there are no code fragments in the supplied code that require investigation for Rule 21.14.
